Text: At the end of each player’s turn, place one counter (using dice, coins, etc.) on the most expensive card or cards in the trade row. Cards cost 1 Trade less for each counter on them.

Name: Commitment to the Cause
Text: Scouts and Explorers produce an additional 1 Trade. Vipers produce an additional 1 Combat.

Name: Early Recruitment
Text: Before the game begins, the player going first chooses one of the four factions. They then select from the trade deck a card of that faction that costs 1 Trade, and add it to their personal deck. The player going second repeats this process, choosing two of the remaining factions. Finally, the player going first repeats the process for the remaining faction.

Name: Emergency Repairs
Text: Once per turn, a player may spend 1 Trade to shuffle their discard pile into their personal deck.

Name: Entrenched Loyalties
Text: At the start of the game, assign each player a faction at random. Cards of that faction cost that player 1 Trade less to acquire. (The same faction may be assigned to multiple players.)

Name: Flare Mining
Text: Once per turn, a player may spend 1 Trade to draw a card, then discard a card.

Name: Fleeting Opportunities
Text: At the start of each player’s turn, scrap the card in the trade row furthest from the trade deck, slide all the other cards over one space, then add the top card of the trade deck to the trade row.

Name: Frantic Preparations
Text: Before the game begins, each player removes one Viper and one Scout from their personal decks.

Name: Frontier Expedition
Text: Before the game begins, each player replaces two of the Scouts in their personal deck with Explorers.

Name: Maximum Warp
Text: At the start of each player’s turn, that player draws a card.

Name: Picking Sides
Text: Before the game begins, the player going first chooses one of the four factions. They then select from the trade deck a card of that faction that costs 3 Trade, and add it to their personal deck. The player going second repeats this process, choosing two of the remaining factions. Finally, the player going first repeats the process for the remaining faction.

Name: Prolonged Conflict
Text: At the start of the game, each player gains 30 Authority

Name: Rapid Construction
Text: The first card a player acquires each turn is placed on top of their deck.

Name: Ready Reserves
Text: Cards in a player’s hand are not discarded at the end of their turn. For each card a player keeps, they draw one fewer card at the end of their turn.

Name: Recruiting Drive
Text: Whenever a player acquires a ship, they put it on top of their deck. Bases cost 1 Trade less to acquire.

Name: Rushed Defenses
Text: Bases go directly into play when acquired, and are scrapped when destroyed.

Name: Ruthless Efficiency
Text: Once per turn, a player may spend 1 Trade to scrap a card in their hand.

Name: Total War
Text: Once per turn, a player may spend 1 Trade to gain 3 Combat

Text: Play with two additional cards in the trade row.

Name: Thank You Backers|Kickstarter Promo Pack
Text: Thank you backers for an incredible Kickstarter campaign! As a thank you for your patience and support, we have added a few extra promo cards (2 Powerful Backing and 1 Patience Rewarded)! Thank you again, and I hope you have as much fun playing these Star Realms sets as we had making them! Rob Dougherty - CEO, White Wizard Games | Docking If a ship returns to your hand with docking, it does so AFTER you draw your hand, so you will end your turn with an extra card in hand. Midgate Station If you discard 0 cards with its primary ability, you choose to gain 1 Trade or Combat. “Scrap this card” ally abilities Like any ally abilities, these trigger when you have another card of their faction in play, but you choose if and when to use this ability once it has been triggered. So, if you don’t want to scrap the card, just don’t use the ally ability. Powerful Backing The player currently taking their turn counts as having two extra cards of each faction in play that turn for triggering their ally and double ally abilities. Patience Rewarded Like with all cards where each player makes a choice, start with the player currently taking their turn and proceed clockwise.

Name: Mobilization
Text:
Each player may look at the top four cards of their deck, put any number of those cards into their discard pile, then put the remaining cards back on top of their deck in any order.
When an event enters the trade row, do what it says immediately, then scrap it.

Name: Patience Rewarded
Text:
Each player may scrap a card in the trade row, then set it aside. For the rest of the game, players may acquire the card they set aside as if it were in the trade row.
When an event enters the trade row, do what it says immediately, then scrap it.

When an event enters the trade row, do what it says immediately, then scrap it.

The player currently taking their turn chooses to gain either 2 Trade or 4 Combat. Each other player chooses to either gain 6 Authority or draw a card.
When an event enters the trade row, do what it says immediately, then scrap it.

Name: Le's Foray | Rules (Part 1 of 3)
Text: Scrap: Until end of turn, you may use all of your Star Empire ally abilities. Until end of turn, you may use all of your Machine Cult ally abilities. You may scrap a card in your hand or discard pile. If you do, draw a card. | When playing with the Allignment Command Deck, you are Divine Admiral Le, legendary commander of the Alignment. While you will be able to acquire and play cards of any faction, your starting deck and gambits work particularly well with Star Empire and Machine Cult cards. This Command Deck may be played one-on-one against any other Command Deck, or, you can use it to take on two players playing standard starting decks! <u>2 vs 1</u> When playing against two players, those players use standard starting decks (eight Scout and two Viper cards). They play as a Hydra team with a total of 75 Authority . Hydra teams share a turn, may share trade and combat, but have separate decks and ally triggers (see Star Realms Rulebook, Formats section). <u>Setup</u> At the start of the game, place your Divine Admiral Le card, along with your Alignment Ingenuity and Le’s Foray gambit cards, face up in front of you. Note: Your Divine Admiral Le card is for reference, and does not count as a Star Empire or Machine Cult card in play for triggering Ally Abilities.

Name: Alignment Ingenuity | Rules (Part 2 of 3)
Text: Whenever you use a Scrap ability of a ship or base, you may draw a card, then discard a card. | <u>Setup (Cont.)</u> You have a hand size of six cards and start with 64 Authority. You may track your Authority with the included scorecards. - Rotate and/or flip this card to represent a change in the tens digit. - Slide and/or flip this card to represent a change in the ones digit. Add the two numbers in the circle to get your Authority score. This shows a score of 68. Shuffle the Mech Battleship card into the Trade Deck before laying out the starting Trade Row. This would be a great card for you to buy, but watch out, your opponents are allowed to acquire it as well! Shuffle the other 12 cards (Imperial Talon, Imperial Viper, Ranger, Salvage Drone, [4] Scout, Scout Bot, Stellar Falcon, Viper, and Welder Drone) to create your Personal Deck. When playing first you get a three card starting hand, and when going second you get a six card starting hand.

Name: Divine Admiral Le | Rules (Part 3 of 3)
Text: You have a hand size of six cards and start with 64 Authority. | <u>Alignment Faction Symbol</u> This faction symbol represents both Star Empire and Machine Cult . Mech Battleship counts as a card of both factions, and will trigger the Ally Abilities of either. Its own Ally Ability can be triggered by either a Star Empire or Machine Cult card. <u>Alignment Ingenuity</u> This gambit remains face up in front of you all game. When you use the Scrap ability of a ship or base, first resolve the ability’s effect. Afterwards, you may draw a card, then discard a card. <u>Le’s Foray</u> This gambit remains face up in front of you until you use it. You may do this by scrapping it at any time during your Main Phase. When you use it, you count as having an additional Star Empire and Machine Cult card in play that turn for triggering Ally Abilities. Learn more about playing with Command Decks at: <u>StarRealms.com/CommandDecks</u>

Name: Newburg’s Game | Rules (Part 1 of 3)
Text: Scrap: Gain 3 Combat. Gain 4 Authority. Until end of turn, you may use all of your Blob ally abilities. Until end of turn, you may use all of your Trade Federation ally abilities. Draw a card. | When playing with the Pact Command Deck, you are Overlord Newburg, legendary commander of the Pact. While you will be able to acquire and play cards of any faction, your starting deck and gambits work particularly well with Blob and Trade Federation cards. This Command Deck may be played one-on-one against any other Command Deck, or, you can use it to take on two players playing standard starting decks! <u>2 vs 1</u> When playing against two players, those players use standard starting decks (eight Scout and two Viper cards). They play as a Hydra team with a total of 75 Authority. Hydra teams share a turn, may share trade and combat, but have separate decks and ally triggers (see Star Realms Rulebook, Formats section). <u>Setup</u> At the start of the game, place your Overlord Newburg card, along with your Pact Dominion and Newburg’s Game gambit cards, face up in front of you. Note: Your Overlord Newburg card is for reference, and does not count as a Blob or Trade Federation card in play for triggering Ally Abilities.

Name: Pact Dominion | Rules (Part 2 of 3)
Text: Each turn, the first time you gain Authority also gain 3 Combat | <u>Setup (Cont.)</u> You have a hand size of six cards and start with 66 Authority. You may track your Authority with the included scorecards. - Rotate and/or flip this card to represent a change in the tens digit. - Slide and/or flip this card to represent a change in the ones digit. Add the two numbers in the circle to get your Authority score. This shows a score of 68. Shuffle the Super Carrier card into the Trade Deck before laying out the starting Trade Row. This would be a great card for you to buy, but watch out, your opponents are allowed to acquire it as well! Shuffle the other 12 cards (Cluster Scout, Diplomatic Shuttle, Escort Viper, Frontier Tug, Ranger, Ripper, [4] Scout, Swarmling and Viper) to create your Personal Deck. When playing first you get a three card starting hand, and when going second you get a six card starting hand.

Name: Overlord Newburg | Rules (Part 3 of 3)
Text: You have a hand size of six cards and start with 66 Authority. | <u>Alignment Faction Symbol</u> This faction symbol represents both Blob and Trade Federation . Super Carrier counts as a card of both factions, and will trigger the Ally Abilities of either. Its own Ally Ability can be triggered by either a Blob or Trade Federation card. <u>Pact Dominion</u> This gambit remains face up in front of you all game. It automatically gives you 3 Combat the first time you gain Authority during your Main Phase each turn. It only works during your Main Phase, so if you gain Authority at any other time (like from an event during an opponent’s turn) it won’t work. <u>Newburg’s Game</u> This gambit remains face up in front of you until you use it. You may do this by scrapping it at any time during your Main Phase. When you use it, you count as having an additional Blob and Trade Federation card in play that turn for triggering Ally Abilities. Learn more about playing with Command Decks at: <u>StarRealms.com/CommandDecks</u>

Name: Walsh's Stratagem | Rules (Part 1 of 3)
Text: Scrap: Gain 2 Trade. Until end of turn, you may use all of your Machine Cult ally abilities. Until end of turn, you may use all of your Blob ally abilities. Put the next base you acquire this turn directly into play. | When playing with the Unity Command Deck, you are Biolord Walsh, legendary commander of the Unity. While you will be able to acquire and play cards of any faction, your starting deck and gambits work particularly well with Machine Cult and Blob cards. This Command Deck may be played one-on-one against any other Command Deck, or, you can use it to take on two players playing standard starting decks! 2 vs 1 When playing against two players, those players use standard starting decks (eight Scout and two Viper cards). They play as a Hydra team with a total of 75 Authority. Hydra teams share a turn, may share trade and combat, but have separate decks and ally triggers (see Star Realms Rulebook, Formats section). When playing 2 Vs 1 you may not use your Walsh’s Stratagem gambit on your first turn. Setup At the start of the game, place your Biolord Walsh card, along with your Unity Warcraft and Walsh’s Stratagem gambit cards, face up in front of you. Note: Your Biolord Walsh card is for reference, and does not count as a Machine Cult or Blob card in play for triggering Ally Abilities.

Text: Your bases get +1 defense Your opponent’s bases get -1 defense (This affects both regular bases and Outposts.) | Setup (Cont.) You have a hand size of six cards and start with 70 Authority. You may track your Authority with the included scorecards. - Rotate and/or flip this card to represent a change in the tens digit. - Slide and/or flip this card to represent a change in the ones digit. Add the two numbers in the circle to get your Authority score. This shows a score of 78. Shuffle the Mech Wurm card into the Trade Deck before laying out the starting Trade Row. This would be a great card for you to buy, but watch out, your opponents are allowed to acquire it as well! Shuffle the other 12 cards (Cluster Viper, Laser Drone, Protopod, Ranger, [4] Scout, Scout Bot, Swarmling, Viper, and Welder Drone) to create your Personal Deck. When playing first you get a three card starting hand, and when going second you get a six card starting hand.

Name: Biolord Walsh | Rules (Part 3 of 3)
Text: You have a hand size of six cards and start with 70 Authority. | <u>Unity Faction Symbol</u> This faction symbol represents both Machine Cult and Blob . It continually gives all of your bases +1 Defense and all of your opponent’s bases -1 Defense. <u>Walsh’s Stratagem</u> This gambit remains face up in front of you until you use it. Name: Jochum's Grand Design | Rules (Part 2 of 2)
Text: Scrap: Until end of turn, you may use all of your Star Empire ally abilities. Until end of turn, you may use all of your Trade Federation ally abilities. Until end of turn, you may use all of your Machine Cult ally abilities. Until end of turn, you may use all of your Blob ally abilities. Put a card from your discard pile into your hand. | <u>Setup (Cont.)</u> Shuffle the other 14 cards ([3] Assault Shard, [2] Command Shard, [3] Recon Shard, [3] Salvage Shard, and [3] Transport Shard) to create your Personal Deck. When playing first you get a four card starting hand, and when going second you get a seven card starting hand. <u>Splinter Tech</u> This gambit remains face up in front of you all game. Resolve the Splinter Ability effect before you choose the faction. <u>Jochum’s Grand Design</u> This gambit remains face up in front of you until you use it. You may do this by scrapping it at any time during your Main Phase. When you use it, you count as having an additional Machine Cult , Star Empire , Blob , and Trade Federation card in play that turn for triggering Ally Abilities. Name: Rules: Faction Pairs | United Ad
Text: Alliance = Star Empire + Trade Federation Coalition = Trade Federation + Machine Cult Unity = Machine Cult + Blob Union = Blob + Star Empire Alignment = Star Empire + Machine Cult Pact = Blob + Trade Federation The multicolor symbols above each count as two existing Star Realms factions.
